attributes.action: Introduce a procedure where the people can call for a vote of "no confidence"
attributes.background: In a democracy I believe that if we are able to elect our leader, then we should be able to raise the question of "no confidence" in our elected leader.

attributes.action: Introduce Scandinavian transparency of Personal income and Taxation to the UK.
attributes.background:
In the wake of the Panama papers revelations it is surely  time to Campaign for Scandinavian style transparency of personal income and Taxation.
In Norway, Everyone's Income Is Public—and So Is Tax Paid
The UK must introduce this to shame evaders and close loopholes and discourage tax evasion.
attributes.additional_details:
If taxes paid were publicized, then this would do more than just shame tax evaders. Even in cases where people are legally exploiting the tax laws to their advantage, it would help to create a conversation about the tax code itself. For example, if we learn of some obscure tax credit allows wealthier individuals to consistently avoid paying a major portion of their income taxes, then we could debate whether or not it's good policy. 
Transparency is the best form of disinfectant on this issue.

attributes.action: Move the UK government to a Northern city. Westminster needs massive renovation.
attributes.background: The UK is suffering from the fact that many issues that are important are  centred on the Southern part of it. Scotland wants to break away from the union. The need to refurbish the Palace of Westminster means that moving government can re-balance the nation both politically and financially.
attributes.additional_details: Westminster refurbishment creates a golden opportunity to move UK government to Sheffield, Leeds, Manchester, Liverpool or another suitable location. The effect of moving the UK government to a Northern city will be to create a true and lasting Northern powerhouse through the building of airport, rail & road infrastructure and the services needed to support them. It will create lasting employment in all sectors & through wealth creation will lead to a more financially balanced United Kingdom.

attributes.action: Have in house training for Maternity care assistants/ Msw's to become midwifes.
attributes.background: I am a maternity care assistant and have been for nine years. I work 30 hours whilst studing at college. I am trying to further my education to go on to study midwifery. With the fees and bursary being stopped.  I dont think I can continue to do my chosen career and become a midwife.
attributes.additional_details:
Every year the universities change the entry requirements making it harder.
However, with the change in fees and bursary, it makes it more difficult for us to leave a full paying job.
I feel Maternity Care Assistants should have equal rights and equal oppurtunities like HCA's. They're bringing a new role out called nursing associate for HCA's to train on the job and become a qualified nurse. We should have the same on the job training or bring back the secondment to become a qualified midwife. I

attributes.action: Include HGV training to the Government backed 24+ Advanced Learning Loans.
attributes.background: To expand the 24+ advanced learning government backed loan to cover HGV license acquisition. There is currently a shortage of 45-50,000 drivers in the UK. Other industries are benefiting from the loan but not an industry that can create 50,000 jobs & whereby the loan could be paid back quickly.
attributes.additional_details:
Driver shortage- http://www.theguardian.com/world/2015/oct/25/lorry-driver-shortage-christmas-deliveries-road-haulage-association

Courses covered: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/advanced-learner-loans-qualifications-catalogue

Ave pay for Class 1 (HGV 1) Driver £28,362 PA
http://www.totaljobs.com/salary-checker/average-class-1-driver-salary

attributes.action: Make the Ambulance Service an 'Emergency' service rather than an 'essential' one
attributes.background: Currently the ambulance service is not an emergency service it is classed as an essential service. This is the same as the gas, electricity etc yet retain the 999 status and drive under blue light conditions. The workload is increasing but funding and staff levels falling due to working conditions
attributes.additional_details: The ambulance service are attending more calls for help. Paramedics and Emergency care assistants they are being subjected to over runs, reduced or no breaks and continual pressures of being short staffed with not enough ambulances to cover the number of calls. All are actually underpaid and overworked for the role they now take on, many paramedics earning the same as a newly qualified nurse but making life changing decisions about patient care. We need to give them the recognition they deserve.

attributes.action: Change the law against the spacing of Vehicle Registration Plates.
attributes.background: I don't understand why the spacing of a Registration Plate should be regulated. ANPR Cameras used by police and other authorities pick up an 'illegally' spaced plate so why is there an issue with it?
attributes.additional_details:
I understand the font and size of a plate being illegal but not spacing and feel the law against it could be changed. For reference, instead of a new style plate saying: AB00 ABC why can't it be 
A B00 ABC or any other way as long as the font and size are legal.

attributes.action: Remove license of U.K. National lottery because it's owned by a non uk entity
attributes.background: The U.K. National lottery in 2010 was bought out by the Canadians via the Ontario teachers pension fund!Therefore a very large chunk of the U.K. National lottery profits leaves the U.K.and ends up in Canada!This purchase was kept very quiet for obvious reasons!Let's take the lottery back for the uk!

attributes.action: Change National Planning Policy which permits inappropriate housing development
attributes.background: The current government planning policy means that if councils don't have a 5 year land supply for housing developers can cast aside planning policy and build on our beautiful countryside.  Local opinion and landscape designation are ignored resulting in development on greenfield sites.
attributes.additional_details: Across the country our neighbourhoods are under threat by developers who speculatively submit planning applications knowing that our councils don't have the finances or resources to challenge them.  There is clearly a need for more housing however a huge amount of brownfield available with planning permission which developers are land banking whilst they exploit the weakness in our planning policy that enables them to force through development on cheaper to develop greenfield sites.

attributes.action: Make energy drinks age restricted
attributes.background: Energy drinks are full of caffeine and other ingredients that can lead to serious health issues. I, along with many other people, feel that all energy drinks should be sold under the age restriction law. I feel that the ingredients in energy drinks are not suitable for children younger than 16 years
attributes.additional_details:
Energy drinks are loaded with sugar and caffeine (sometimes more than twice the caffeine that's in a can of cola) so they’ll certainly give you a temporary energy jolt. However, the boost is short-lived and may be accompanied by other problems.
The caffeine in energy drinks can make you feel irritable and restless. It can increase your blood pressure, while the sugar can contribute to weight gain, especially if you don’t exercise regularly. http://www.nhs.uk/Livewell/tiredness-and-fatigue/Pages/energy-mythbuster.aspx

attributes.action: Funding for youth clubs in poorer constituencies to help lessen crime rates.
attributes.background: I believe more youth clubs and projects will allow young people to learn new and important skills, develop compulsory social skills and tolerance and most importantly decrease crime rates in poorer constituencies by keeping kids/ teenagers active and off the streets.

attributes.action: Ban the primate pet trade in the UK
attributes.background: More than 5000 primates including cappuchins and squirrel monkeys, are currently being kept privately as pets in the UK. Being subject to abhorrent conditions, unable to meet their basic physical, social and psychological needs, the primates are forced to live a life they'd rather not live.
attributes.additional_details:
Many of these monkeys fortunately end up in sanctuaries such as Wild Futures UK, set up to ensure their protection and meet the needs that had been withheld from them. But even then, many of these monkeys can never be returned to the wild they were taken from due to their inability to fit in with wild monkeys. The psychological damage many primates face  means they could never survive in the wild.

Join me and various UK organisations in calling for a complete ban on the primate pet trade

attributes.action: Cohabiting couples who split should get the same legal rights as married.
attributes.background: I have been with my partner for 26 years living together for over 20 years. We have 2 children together he has many properties and a business. The relationship has broken down and I find myself not entitled to a penny as he has not put my name on any of his properties which were bought together.

attributes.action: Stop basing student loans on parental income.
attributes.background: When applying for university, any loans or grants that are received are based on parental income, penalising families who of a moderate or higher income. It is not fair on families that have twins or families that have parents who are self employed as 50% of that money goes back in the business!
attributes.additional_details: As tuition fees increase at an unrealistic and exponential level, student are expected to repay money that realistically is unaffordable. Not only this, but loans and bursaries are based on parental income as they expect your parents to be able to pay ridiculous amounts towards your education. It is not their degree so why should they have to pay! Why is it based on their income? It's a heavy penalty to pay penalising larger families, people with twins, self employed parents and so on.

attributes.action: Tax disc to start from date applied, not start of month
attributes.background:
Since 2014, vehicle excise duty has been solely electronic, with no requirement to show a tax disc in the windscreen of the vehicle.

Therefore with MOT and insurance being 12 months from start, there is no reason for tax not to be the same.
attributes.additional_details: People who buy a vehicle automatically have to renew the road tax on the vehicle. If somebody chooses to buy a car on (for example) the 15th of a month, they're losing two weeks worth of money for no reason, because the tax is back dated to the 1st of the month, when they didn't even own the vehicle. There is no longer a reason for this, given all details are electronic. It wouldn't even cost the treasury a penny as people still have to renew it annually.

attributes.action: The DfT should urgently plan and fund a mass transit system for Leeds
attributes.background: Leeds is the largest city in western Europe without a mass transit system. Leeds has the third worst air quality in the UK and has recently been warned over exceeding World Health Organisation's air quality limits.
attributes.additional_details: Today it as been announced that central government aren't going to back a mass transit system that, however flawed it was, would have gone some way to improving these issues. These plans were ten years and £60m in the making. Please  sign this petition if you believe that local MPs, councillors and the DfT should be compelled to produce a plan and find the funding for an immediate transport intervention for Leeds and the city region.

attributes.action: All British citizens shall have the right to vote in national referendums.
attributes.background: All British citizens must have the right to participate in referendums that are national in extent. The rule that bars citizens from voting in constituency elections if they have lived outside the country for more than 15 years shall not apply to voting in national referendums.
attributes.additional_details: All British citizens are affected by the outcome of national referendums; therefore, all British citizens must have the right to vote in said referendums, no matter where in the world they live and no matter how long they have lived outside the country. No national referendum shall be conducted until this matter is resolved and all loyal subjects are granted this fundamental democratic right.

attributes.action: Change In Dog Walking Legislation - In Public Places Within The UK
attributes.background:
I am calling for a change in the law to make it compulsory all dog owners in the UK have sufficient control over their dog by making it mandatory dogs are walked on a lead in public places at all times.
I believe action is required due to the number of dog attacks particularly on young children.
attributes.additional_details:
Dogs which are not under the direct control of their owners can be unpredictable and cause anxiety to people of all ages, all dogs are potentially dangerous. 
My own child was attacked by a dog at the age of 3 and is left permanently scarred, I have friends who have experienced their child being attacked and I feel strongly that the law needs changed.

attributes.action: Reverse the 40% tax threshold increase & apply savings to disability benefits
attributes.background: I am a 40% taxpayer.  From 2017 I will be better off by £141.50 a year by virtue of increases to the 40% tax threshold.  I don't need this money but many others do.  Savings from reversing this increase should be applied to those who have recently had their benefits slashed - the disabled.
attributes.additional_details: My annual savings have been calculated using online calculators such as that published by The Independent http://www.independent.co.uk/news/business/news/budget-2016-use-our-calculator-to-work-out-how-the-tax-changes-affect-you-a6934526.html and reports of cuts to the Personal Independence Payment http://www.theguardian.com/society/2016/mar/13/cuts-will-see-200000-disabled-people-lose-3000-a-year

attributes.action: Legalise Polygyny (marriage of more than one wife)
attributes.background: The institution of marriage has been redefined in the UK with the recent legalisation of same-sex marriage, we see no rational reason, scientific, religious, or otherwise for polygyny to remain illegal. Many women will remain oppressed and without rights under the current legislation.
attributes.additional_details: Many second and third wives are being denied their conjugal rights, such as maintenance, child-maintenance, inheritance etc. due to not being legally registered by law and are treated as mistresses. The current law is irrational, discriminatory, and oppressive towards some minority cultures who deem marriage as the sole means of intimate relationship between a man and a woman, this makes it difficult for women who are widowed, divorced, or unable to find suitable husbands.

attributes.action: Equal voting rights for EU citizens resident in the UK - Void the referendum
attributes.background:
British citizens who lived in the EU for more than 15 years were not permitted a vote. As such parity should exist for EU citizens who have lived and contributed to British society for more than 15 years.
On these grounds the referendum to leave the EU should be re-run to allow a fair vote for all.
attributes.additional_details: EU citizens are currently permitted to vote in Local and European Elections regardless of how long they have been resident and paid taxes for, but have been blocked from voting in Parliamentary Elections. There are many EU citizens who have lived in the UK for longer than 15 years, as are there Briish Citizens who have lived elsewhere in the EU. Both groups were discriminated by not being allowed to vote on their future on June the 23rd 2016 in the Referendum to Remain or Leave the EU.

attributes.action: Create new Animal and Domestic Pet Protection legislation to imprison abusers
attributes.background: Britian is a nation of animal lovers, with an estimated 46% of households having a domestic pet. Unfortunately however, animal cruelty offences continue to occur, with very little in the way of "animal rights" to prevent them, or to punish offenders. Pets mean more than the "property" defined in law
attributes.additional_details:
Recently introduced legislation in the US will allow courts to treat those who abuse animals in the same vein as humans. Numerous physiological research conclude that one of the first steps towards a person being mentally capable of taking another human life often start off abusing and killing animals

At the moment pet homocide can only be treated as 'criminal damage', but with people like the Croydon cat killer freely walking the streets we believe stronger legislation should be introduced.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for a company to require only women to wear makeup at work
attributes.background: Following Nicola Thorp's petition on high heels, it should also be illegal to require women to wear makeup at work, except in circumstances where it genuinely is required and a man would also be required to do so (e.g. theatrical productions, but there is no excuse for offices).
attributes.additional_details: Makeup is expensive (and cannot normally be claimed back as a work expense), time consuming (you won't normally get paid for that time) and can damage skin. Contrary to sexist stereotypes not all women have been wearing it daily since their teens, and some would actually be unable to do a professional-looking makeup job at all. This should not stop someone getting a job. Note that most schools actually ban children, including older teens, from wearing it.

attributes.action: Stop Criminalizing/Banning U.K Drivers For Smoking Cannabis Days Before Driving.
attributes.background: Cannabis Users Are Being Driven Off Of The U.K Roads In Staggering Numbers Due To Smoking Cannabis Days Before Driving Why ?
attributes.additional_details:
The Governments Own Drug Advisor's State That Cannabis Can Take Up To 10 Days To Leave The System With Other Sources Saying Up To 67 Days In Chronic Users  
https://www.drugabuse.gov/publications/marijuana-facts-teens/want-to-know-more-some-faqs-about-marijuana

While The Nhs Say It Can Show For Weeks 
https://www.drugabuse.gov/publications/marijuana-facts-teens/want-to-know-more-some-faqs-about-marijuana

And As The High From Cannabis Last No Longer Then A Few Hours How Is This Fair.

attributes.action: Calling for government to pressure foreign governments to stop child soldiers.
attributes.background: The use of chid soldiers in developing countries is worrying. They are used to murder civilians and soldiers alike. In many cases the children would be forced to slaughter there own families. Before the age of 18 they are already in war. we need to fix this.
attributes.additional_details: Currently there is an estimated 250,000 child soldiers, that have been recruited by both governments and rebel groups. Often the children would be forced to murder a family member to sever there connections with community. This makes it hard for them to ever return home. In 10 years; 10 million children have suffered from psychological trauma, 2 million children have been murdered, one million children have been left orphaned and a further 2 million have suffered from life altering injuries.

attributes.action: Introduce homophobia and why it's wrong into secondary school curriculum
attributes.background: We want teachers and students to be more aware about homophobia within schools. By teaching teenagers in their PCSHE lessons about the LGBT community and why it's wrong to discriminate and bully we can help to stop the ever so popular "that's so gay" phrase being used in schools all over the UK.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.stonewall.org.uk/get-involved/education/secondary-schools - This gave us a really big insight on homophobia in schools and how it's much more common than you'd think.

attributes.action: Change marriage law in favour of same sex marriages in the Church in Wales
attributes.background: Like many people I dream of the perfect wedding day -  the Church In Wales played a massive part in my life and I would love to celebrate my marriage in a place that I hold very close to my heart.Marriage law has excluded the church in Wales from being able to celebrate same sex marriages.
attributes.additional_details: Despite a majority vote in favour of the Church in Wales being able to celebrate same sex marriages, the margins were too narrow for it to be passed. Marriage Law has excluded the Church in Wales from being able to celebrate same sex marriages in its churches and cathedrals and there are no plans currently for the Governing Body of the Church in Wales to petition Parliament for change in the near future.  Lets get this petition going and make a change that every one has the right to.

attributes.action: Allow people resident in UK for 5 years to vote in the 2nd EU Referendum
attributes.background: Non British citizen resident in UK for more than 5 years are a vital part of this country as they are taxpayers and contributing actively to the future of the country. By law they could ask to become British citizens so it's only fair to give them the right to vote in such an important Referendum.

attributes.action: Stop the use of the Professional Skills tests (Qualified Teacher Status QTS)
attributes.background: My daughter has ADHD. She's been offered a degree with QTS but failed the tests twice. The format causes sensory issues for her. Why is she not competent when she passed her GCSEs with an AB&C in 2014? Why are we allowing discriminating tests to lose passionate teachers of our future generations?
attributes.additional_details:
All prospective trainee teachers must pass the skills tests before they can be recommended for the award of qualified teacher status (QTS). It consists of two exams, some questions are written and presented in a series of on-screen questions, others are audio with headphones. 
Surely we should be ensuring we train the right people and not place a barrier in their way that appears to be meaningless and provides no evidence to support it has any impact on the selection process?

attributes.action: Free childcare when both parents are working. Not just those who are on benefits
attributes.background: Free childcare is in place for 2 year olds where the parents have low income and mostly on benefits and don't work. If the parents are not working then their children don't need childcare. My husband and I work very hard to provide for our family but have to pay huge amount of money for childcare.
attributes.additional_details: When childcare is paid for when both parents are working it makes a huge dent in income, we could do with the help. All children deserve this, It seems as though I would be better off not working.

attributes.action: Transport Minister Patrick McLoughlin Cap Or Further Subsidise Train Fares
attributes.background: Train fares are just too costly for the average commuter/traveller. 35 minutes away from a main city can cost a yearly total of £3,320.00 which accounts for 12.7% of the average national salary. This figure is too high and continues to increase. Hence, we are calling on a cap or further subsidy.
attributes.additional_details:
"Since privatisation, the average price of a train journey has increased by 22% and walk-on tickets on some routes have been hiked by 245%. The TUC looked at the cost of UK rail commutes against similar European journeys in France, Germany and Spain. It found that we’re paying 3x more of our salary just to get to work and back." - (The Independent) 
http://www.independent.co.uk/travel/uk/why-are-uk-rail-fares-so-expensive-9678640.html

attributes.action: Let the people of the UK decide if it should be split by Scotland's departure.
attributes.background: Scots had a referendum to decide if Scotland should be independent - and decided against. If they decide to try again there should be a referendum of the whole of the UK instead - the decision is bigger than just what Scotland wants - it is about what the UK wants and the future of our country.

attributes.action: Govt is not entitled to hold a view on the EU referendum, only individuals.
attributes.background: We the undersigned, believe it is unconstitutional and wholly inappropriate, for the UK govt to hold an opinion (Either way) on the potential outcome of the EU referendum and it is certainly not right, to instruct Civil Servants that they may not speak freely on the matter, as they so believe.
attributes.additional_details: We live in a Constitutional Monarchy, with Parliamentary Democracy, however the recent actions of Mr Cameron have turned this country into a Banana Republic. At the very least, Parliament should first debate, whether or not it is right for the Government to use the Civil Service, the way it is intending to, in the lead up to this referendum. Rigging the entire debate as Government, is not providing a free, fair and impartial debate on the issue, to the people, which is what it should be.

attributes.action: Change wording from father and mother to parents on all legal certificates.
attributes.background: In 2014 a bill was won to include mothers names on marriage certificates, this still doesn't reflect the way we live, as some families will be made up of two mothers or two fathers and legal guardians who are ALL the parents of the children.
attributes.additional_details: Yet on many if not all legal certificates and documents only space is there for one mother or one father and then an additional space for parent. If or when a child decides to marry they too will be faced with who to name, as there is space for only one of their mothers or fathers, by changing the wording to parents this will avoid the confusion and recognise the make up of their family.

attributes.action: We ask government to help fund the efforts of "soldiers off the street".
attributes.background: "Soldiers off the street" was founded in 2009, they are a registered charity (1137594 ), their aim is to ensure that no British service man or woman should have to live rough on the streets of the UK, they have already done great things but its time that the UK government chipped in to help out.
attributes.additional_details: "SOTS" are committed to making life better for ex service personnel whose lives have been affected by homelessness. Soldiers off the streets intend to make a positive impact on the lives of the people that have given so much to this country then left to fend for themselves. Many of them with other problems such as Brain shock, Gulf War Syndrome and Post-traumatic Stress Disorder, please get behind this petition, https://www.facebook.com/Soldiers-Off-The-Street-SOTS-146394338732643/timeline

attributes.action: Stop employers from making women redundant whilst on maternity leave
attributes.background: More should be done to protect women on maternity leave from losing their jobs.I was made redundant 4 months into my maternity leave and was left feeling the financial and mental effects of not having a job. Not entitled to redundancy pay or any government support. I now feed my son on £20 a week.
attributes.additional_details: More and more employers use "strategic changes" during maternity leave as a reason to push women out of their business. This causes women and families great distress at a time that should be happy and memorable. Having a child can be a financial shock and adding the pressure of taking someone's income away from them at such a sensitive time can be soul destroying and causes families to become desperate, especially those whom the government doesn't offer any support to.

attributes.action: Do not take away emergency surgery away from Tameside hospital
attributes.background: If anyone is to have a accident around the Tameside area you will have to be taken to Manchester, When Tameside hospital is down graded to a community hospital. This will risk over 300 life's a year taking patients longer to get the help they need. This could be a family member a friend let's say NO
attributes.additional_details:
Manchester evening news printed a story saying around 370 life's will be at risk each year. 

Doctors and nurses at the hospital are not happy about the hospital being downgraded

attributes.action: Refuse any request for another Scottish independence referendum before May 2020
attributes.background: The constitution is a reserved matter and therefore no consent should be given to another Scottish referendum before May 2020.
attributes.additional_details: The Scotland Act 1998 states that the constitution is a reserved matter therefore consent has to be given by Westminster before any future Scottish independence referendum could take place.

attributes.action: Ensure that the Brexit EU deal maintains free trade, research, and movement.
attributes.background: After the Leave vote, we must ensure that the rights and prosperity of UK citizens are protected. We believe that this means any deal should ensure our rights as UK citizens to live and work around the EU, maintain single market access to protect British jobs, and continue academic collaboration.
attributes.additional_details: Such a deal would likely be similar to that between the EU and Norway; whilst this may involve the UK continuing to pay some EU budget contributions, we accept the views of most economists that single market access is valuable enough to make this worthwhile. This deal will likely involve accepting free movement into Britain, too, and we welcome this; EU migrants are at the heart of British life, playing a vital role in many economic sectors but more importantly being our neighbours and friends.

attributes.action: Stop The Council Penalty Charges for Driving in Bus Lanes on Bank Holidays!
attributes.background:
I was given 3 separate tickets for driving in a bus lane on a Bank Holiday by Harrow Council, each a few seconds apart.

I do not drive on bus lanes but after my investigation, I realised it was on a bank holiday and I must have assumed because it was bank holiday the same rules on Sunday applies.
attributes.additional_details:
Stop The Council from issuing Penalty Charges for Driving in Bus Lanes on Bank Holidays!

There are many motorists with the same stories. 

http://www.govyou.co.uk/remove-the-ambiguity-re-bank-holiday-use-of-bus-lanes/

http://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/news/local-news/warning-reveal-number-drivers-fined-8789712

attributes.action: Ensure councils have adequate maintenance funding so Parkruns can remain free
attributes.background: Parkruns are free for people of all ages and abilities, providing benefits for health and the community. Stoke Gifford Parish Council have voted to charge Parkrun. Its free nature means many who otherwise wouldn't or can't participate have made positive impacts on their health and community
attributes.additional_details: Promoting health and exercise will save the government money on the NHS and help keep people healthy

attributes.action: Make taking pictures of children in public without carers consent illegal
attributes.background: My 3yr old neice was photographed at the beach by a stranger, she was specifically targeted, the man followed her around to take the pics, the police were called but because no crime had been commited the man walked free with his phone and there was an uncertainty as to whether the pics were deleted
attributes.additional_details:
Children are extremely vulnerable and I feel that by it being legal for strangers to target and photograph them, this puts them in an even more vulnerable state.
It should not be right for strangers to be allowed to have photographs of our children on their phones. This needs to be stopped.

attributes.action: The government must also put case for leaving the EU on it's referendum leaflet.
attributes.background: I believe that democracy should be fair and that this country should have an honest referendum on it's membership of the EU without the government using tax payers money to fund one side of the argument in a blatant attempt to sway voters to the remain side.
attributes.additional_details: The government is spending £9million on a referendum leaflet.

attributes.action: The Education Secretary should be required to have had real teaching experience
attributes.background: Having 'once been to school' (and especially if it was a fee-paying school) is not a qualification for setting state policy for education. The current and past Education Secretaries generally have no understanding of the pressures faced by modern teachers or pupils.
attributes.additional_details: I recently signed a petition regarding a specific decision on education policy. However, I realised that none of the nonsensical and impractical decision-making would change until someone with a working, practical knowledge of life in a school and classroom takes charge. I would add an addendum that a significant proportion of the executive staff of the Department for Education should also have teaching experience. Education is too important to be a political football for short-term gain.

attributes.action: Funding for every primary school to employ a primary PE teacher
attributes.background: Most primary schools are funded around £9000 per year as a sports premium. From my experience I believe this should be increased and the funding should include the cost of a fully qualified PE teacher to teach curriculum PE in all primary schools.
attributes.additional_details: The benefits of this include; All pupils having a great start in physical education from the age of 4, raise the quality and amount of competitive sport in primary schools, be on par with private school education.

attributes.action: To consider an immediate moratorium on child imprisonment.
attributes.background: Imprisonment is not appropriate for vulnerable children offenders, often from profoundly challenging and damaged backgrounds and with complex overlapping social and mental health needs.
attributes.additional_details: The recent revelations of the abuse by G4S at Medway STC by BBC Panorama; the number of injuries in secure training centres is 5 times higher than official data by Home Office minister Mike Penning, and the scores of deaths each year of incarcerated children. A rethink is urgently required in the interests of child protect and public protection. Care not prisonfare must be the way forward. Prisons do not work to deter or reduce crime and has been shown to exacerbate crime and social injustice.

attributes.action: Palestine formally recognised as an independent state by the United Kingdom.
attributes.background: Palestine, once a protectorate of the U K abused by UK foreign policy since 1948, formally be recognised as an independent state. This state based on the borders established in 1948, having full U K recognition as an independent state. Post 1948 Palestine deliberately colonised by a foreign state.
attributes.additional_details: The UN Treaty and Charter formed in 1945 was ratified by the then UK gov. 1948, Human Rights of Palestinian and Jewish peoples were in tension; each a homeland for their own peoples. The international community split Palestine in 1948. This solution was and is highly contentious, with the Palestinian people for the past 70 years suffering and reacting to this decision. The UK needs to demonstrate its equal support to both Israel and Palestine states by treating and recognising them both equally.

attributes.action: Abolish Ofsted
attributes.background:
Ofsted's chief executive has confirmed that Sunday Schools hosted by churches are at risk of inspection  and regulation.

Ofsted is no longer concerned with maintaining standards in schools but has a more sinister 'big brother' agenda.

attributes.action: Agree that anonymity for those accused of sexual violence will not be debated.
attributes.background: Every year people are calling for anonymity for those accused of sexual violence to occur. This is potentially dangerous and can lead to victims being silenced and for more people to become victims. We need clear guidance from government that changing the status quo will not happen.
attributes.additional_details:
John Worbouys
Jimmy Savile
Stuart Hall
Rolf Harris to name but a few who all denied being guilty. 

Anonymity for some crimes and not others is not fair and is not justice.

attributes.action: Enforce equal and nondiscriminatory insurance policies for young drivers.
attributes.background: Young drivers aged 18+ face extremely unfair and ridiculous insurance fees for car insurance. These vary from £10,000 to well over £50,000, often costing 4/5 times the price of a car itself. How is it i am mature enough to have two jobs whilst attending college, but not drive a car affordably.
attributes.additional_details: Insurance companies are exploiting young drivers at rates which many can not afford. This behaviour goes completely against the whole notion of equality which Britain prides itself upon and discriminates heavily against the young and disabled preventing them from having equal opportunities in life as those who are older.
